articles.title: All the important news from the ongoing India AI Impact Summit
articles.description: India is hosting a four-day AI Summit this week that will be attended by executives from major AI labs and Big Tech, including OpenAI, Anthropic, Nvidia, Microsoft, Google, and Cloudflare, as well as heads of state.
articles.author: Ivan Mehta

articles.title: Google VP warns that two types of AI startups may not survive
articles.description: As generative AI evolves, a Google VP warns that LLM wrappers and AI aggregators face mounting pressure, with shrinking margins and limited differentiation threatening their long-term viability.
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan

articles.title: Can the creator economy stay afloat in a flood of AI slop?
articles.description: On the latest episode of Equity, we debated what’s next for the creator economy, and whether there will be any room for the next generation of creators to stand out.
articles.author: Anthony Ha

articles.title: Microsoft’s new gaming CEO vows not to flood the ecosystem with ‘endless AI slop’
articles.description: Is Microsoft's gaming division doubling down on AI?
articles.author: Anthony Ha

articles.title: India's Sarvam launches Indus AI chat app as competition heats up
articles.description: Sarvam's Indus chat app is currently available in beta.
articles.author: Jagmeet Singh

articles.title: The creator economy's ad revenue problem and India's AI ambitions
articles.description: The creator economy is evolving fast, and ad revenue alone isn't cutting it anymore. YouTubers are launching product lines, acquiring startups, and building actual business empires. In fact, MrBeast's company bought fintech startup Step, and his chocolate business is outearning his media arm. This isn't just one creator's strategy. For many, it's the new playbook.  On this episode of TechCrunch's Equity podcast, hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, and Rebecca Bellan unpack how creators are diversifying beyond ads, [...]
articles.author: Theresa Loconsolo

articles.title: OpenAI debated calling police about suspected Canadian shooter's chats
articles.description: Jesse Van Rootselaar's descriptions of gun violence were flagged by tools that monitor ChatGPT for misuse.
articles.author: Tim Fernholz

articles.title: 6 days left to lock in the lowest TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 rates
articles.description: Super Early Bird pricing for TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 ends February 27 at 11:59 p.m. PT. That means you have just 6 days left to secure up to $680 of ticket savings.
articles.author: TechCrunch Events

articles.title: Sam Altman would like to remind you that humans use a lot of energy, too
articles.description: "It also takes a lot of energy to train a human."
articles.author: Anthony Ha

articles.title: 7 days until ticket prices rise for TechCrunch Disrupt 2026
articles.description: Lowest ticket prices to TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 end February 27. Up to $680 off individual passes and up to 30% off group passes. Register before they go up to join 10,000 founders, tech operators, and VCs.
articles.author: TechCrunch Events
